image.altText: Tom Cruise jumped from the roof of the Stade de France during the Olympic closing ceremony.

props.synopsis: Tom Cruise abseils into the Olympic stadium in a symbolic handing over of the Games from Paris to Los Angeles, in a star-studded closing ceremony. Follow live.

title.children: Tom Cruise abseils into the stadium as Paris hands the Olympic Games to Los Angeles

image.altText: Debris from a helicopter crash in Far North Queensland.

props.synopsis: Police have declared an emergency around the building on Cairns Esplanade and evacuated up to 400 people.

title.children: 'Colossal ear-deafening bang': Hundreds evacuated after helicopter crashes into roof of Far North Queensland hotel

image.altText: A man winces looking at the camera as he wrings liquid from some black material.

props.synopsis: In the deeply disparaging texts, the former Spotlight executive producer repeatedly refers to a fictitious character wanting to cave someone's head in.

title.children: Channel 7's ex-Spotlight boss Mark Llewellyn sent 'anti-Semitic' and offensive texts to producer Taylor Auerbach

image.altText: A close up of a McDonalds sign above a restraunt on a street.

props.synopsis: Concerned shareholders are using their small financial stakes to push companies like McDonald's to confront the issue. Here's what happened when a group of Texan nuns and an Australian super fund did just that.

title.children: Why an Australian super fund and Texan nuns are lobbying the world’s biggest fast-food company

image.altText: Matthew Glaetzer stands with his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: Matthew Glaetzer has waited his whole career for an Olympic medal. Now, after a decade of bad luck, some finally goes his way in a dramatic keirin final that sees both he and Matthew Richardson win medals.

title.children: Aussie sprinters end stunning Olympics on emphatic high

image.altText: Last day (1)

props.synopsis: Matt Glaetzer 'does a Bradbury' to claim bronze, New Zealand marks new ground with an emotional haka, and the final finisher in the women's marathon gets a hero's welcome. Here are some moments you may have missed overnight in Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Aussie 'does a Bradbury' after cycling stack, an emotional haka for Kiwi champ, and marathon runner gets a hero's ovation

image.altText: Australia's Opals hug each other after beating Belgium to the bronze medal at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Ezi Magbegor lifts Australia past an inspired Belgium and back onto the Olympic podium as the Opals prevail 85-81 in a brilliant bronze medal play-off in Paris.

title.children: Normal programming resumes as Opals return to Olympic podium for first time in 12 years

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up his hand to take a question at ta press conference

props.synopsis: Politics is best played as a game of offence, but for incumbents across the world in what feels like a never-ending cost of living crisis, it has become a battle of defence and managing souring public sentiment.

title.children: This is a pivotal week for Anthony Albanese as he reaches for the reset button

image.altText: The side of a building with a wall collapsed and trees desrtoyed with rubble around

props.synopsis: Gazan officials say at least 90 people were killed in an air strike on a school, but Israel is refuting the severity, claiming it was targeting Hamas militants.

title.children: Israel struck a Gaza school on the weekend. Here's what we know

image.altText: Two corflute signs side-by-side on the ground, showing the faces of NT politicians Eva Lawler and Lia Finocchiaro.

props.synopsis: Faced with rising crime and cost-of-living pressures, the major parties have made some bold commitments ahead of the NT election. With early voting opening on Monday, here's what voters have been promised.

title.children: With early voting to open tomorrow, here's what the major parties have promised Territorians this election

image.altText: A large white sign showing a coat of arms and the words "local court".

props.synopsis: An inquest into the fatal overdose of a Darwin nurse has handed down its findings, with the NT coroner finding "an offence may have been committed".

title.children: Coroner refers 'suspicious death' of Darwin nurse to DPP for further investigation

image.altText: A close-up shot of an older man with a long white beard.

props.synopsis: He's famous for roles in some of Australia's finest movies, from Breaker Morant to Wake in Fright. But it was the year he spent in the territory outback as a teenager that Jack Thompson says had an impact that has "lasted me my life".

title.children: Actor Jack Thompson reflects on his teenage outback 'adventure that lasted me my life'

image.altText: beachside mansions at noosa heads

props.synopsis: Across Australia renters are facing record-high rents and low vacancy rates. But how much platforms like Stayz and Airbnb are to blame depends on who you ask.

title.children: Renters fear being pushed out of coastal market where short-term stays outnumber rentals 17 to 1

image.altText: dog sleeping on a desk

props.synopsis: A company policy to allow dogs in the workplace has expanded from one day to five at a Hobart-based business after employees discover the health benefits of having pets in the office.

title.children: Who let the dogs in? The health benefits of having pets in the office

image.altText: ASIO spy chief Mike Burgess

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic spy chief has warned people would be shocked to learn the identity of the countries his agency has caught actively interfering in diaspora communities.

title.children: Spy chief warns friendly nations among the countries interfering in Australian communities

image.altText: Wind towers on a ridge at sunset

props.synopsis: Landholders have knocked back tens of thousands of dollars to host turbines as about 40 per cent of approved renewable projects do not proceed to completion.

title.children: Challenges arise as renewable energy gathers speed in country NSW

image.altText: Two whales in open water

props.synopsis: In a rare and unexpected sight, two mammoth humpback whales have been spotting swimming up the Brisbane River.

title.children: Two whales swimming up Brisbane River likely escaping mating male

image.altText: Concept art showing an AFL oval and players with spectators watching from a nearby pavilion.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's opposition has urged the state government to reveal if it will move a proposed AFL high performance centre on Hobart's eastern shore to a different location, days after a poll revealed a slim majority of support for the preferred location.

title.children: AFL training centre proposal for Rosny in question after government accused of 'back-peddling'

image.altText: A burning building

props.synopsis: Russia is fighting intense battles against thousands of Ukrainian troops as deep as 20 kilometres inside the Kursk region after Ukraine's biggest attack on Russian sovereign territory since the start of the war.

title.children: Russia evacuates more than 76,000 people in Kursk region, Zelenskyy vows to 'restore justice'

image.altText: Red earth of the Yalgoo townsite from above

props.synopsis: Three people have been killed, including a baby, after a single-vehicle rollover in Western Australia's Yalgoo region. WA Premier Roger Cook has described it as a "horrible, horrible incident".

title.children: Two women and a baby die after car rolls in WA's Mid-West

image.altText: DSC06537 copy

props.synopsis: For most of his life, rock star Nick Cave says he was "in awe of his own genius". Cataclysmic life events fundamentally "re-arranged" him.

title.children: 'I wasn't remotely in showroom condition': Nick Cave says Kylie Minogue was brave to step into his world

image.altText: Two men in suits stand in front of the Australian flag, with one speaking and the other looking at him

props.synopsis: ASIO told the newly elected Albanese government in mid-2022 to lower Australia's national terror alert level to "possible", but Labor stalled on the advice for almost half a year before enacting it.

title.children: Labor stalled for months on lowering terror alert level after ASIO recommendation in 2022

image.altText: Nobel laureate economist, Joseph Stiglitz, says "neoliberal capitalism" contributed to the rise of new fascist movements

props.synopsis: The attacks on democracy and freedom "have never been greater in my lifetime," warns Nobel Prize-winning economist Joseph Stiglitz.

title.children: 'Neoliberal capitalism' has contributed to the rise of fascism, says Nobel laureate

image.altText: Ugandan men in masks and jackets carry stretchers over a huge pile of mud and rubbish.

props.synopsis: A rescue operation is underway after a large chunk of garbage broke off the landfill on Friday evening, crushing and burying homes on the edge of the site as residents slept.

title.children: Eighteen dead after garbage 'landslide' crushes houses at Ugandan capital's only rubbish dump

image.altText: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: A well-funded lobby group has been spending millions on US election races to punish Democrats who don't toe the line on Israel.

title.children: The pro-Israel lobby came for 'the Squad' — and sent a message to Kamala Harris

image.altText: Two men stand on stage together

props.synopsis: The campaign of the Republican US presidential candidate made the statement, without direct evidence, citing previous tensions between the former US president and Iran.

title.children: Donald Trump’s campaign says its emails were hacked by Iran

image.altText: Sifan Hassan looks up with a Dutch flag wrapped around her

props.synopsis: The women's marathon served as the concluding athletics event at the Olympic Games for the first time at Paris 2024, and it was won by a performance that did its historic status justice.

title.children: Historic Hassan claims third medal of Games by winning groundbreaking marathon

image.altText: Charlie Curnow in pain after injuring his ankle

props.synopsis: Carlton is sweating on the result of scans on Charlie Curnow's ankle after he was one of five players injured in a horror 74-point loss to Hawthorn on Sunday.

title.children: 'He was fine to go': Carlton's medical staff under fire after Charlie Curnow aggravates existing ankle injury

image.altText: Two men celebrate after scoring a try in a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Rookie Newcastle flyer Fletcher Sharpe has announced himself to the NRL after claiming a four-try haul in the Knights clash with the Tigers.

title.children: A star is born in Newcastle after rookie snags spectacular four-try haul

image.altText: A night time photo of a Queensland Police Service car with its blue light illuminated.

props.synopsis: Two cars travelling in opposite directions, each with four occupants, crashed near Airlie Beach on Sunday afternoon, killing two people and injuring the remaining six.

title.children: Two people killed and six injured in two-car collision in the Whitsundays

image.altText: A police car park next to a sign that says "park entrance"

props.synopsis: Queensland police say a 24-year-old man suffered a stab wound to his back and died after being taken to Hervey Bay Hospital.

title.children: Girl charged with murder over alleged stabbing at caravan park

image.altText: An old photo of Marilyn taking a photo of her daughter, who is next to her husband, outside a church.

props.synopsis: Audra Keeble remembers the "touchy feely" photographer's assistant at her wedding who kept adjusting her veil and dress. It was a piece of a puzzle she wouldn't solve until years later, as she uncovered the truth about her life.

title.children: A fake photographer's assistant snuck into this woman's wedding. She only found out who it was years later

image.altText: Four men in front of a rock map look out from a cape

props.synopsis: Less than 10 kilometres from the Burrup and its billions of dollars of industry, West Intercourse Island will join Murujuga National Park to protect it from future industrial development.

title.children: Dampier island's transfer to traditional owners to support World Heritage bid, further its protection

image.altText: The green-blue aurora borealis seen in the night sky over a large hill/mountain

props.synopsis: Do you feel at peace under the stars? That effect is supported by research, which links our connectedness to the night sky to general wellbeing.

title.children: Want to boost your mental health? Step outside and look up at the night sky
